results.title: The Best thing about conflict (NP)
results.creator_credit: Mark Davis, Open Learning Agency of Australia, Monash University and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Everybody’s business: management in action (NP)”.
Conflict is a necessary and everyday reality in many organisations and has the potential for both positive and negative outcomes. Managers should aim to both use and resolve conflict and develop effective negoatiation skills. In this episode we find out that conflict is usually unwelcome but sometimes constructive depending on how it is managed.

results.title: The Best Remaining Seats
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Filmstruck Series”.
John Baxter, well known Australian historian and cinema critic, examines the fall of the great cinema houses, how the Hollywood industry built them and Hollywood acted as a magnet for both talent and money. Charlie Chaplin’s career is also analysed. This episode is one of the “Filmstruck” series which considers the impact of cinema on the social and personal life of the viewing audience.

results.title: The Best of...What's Left of...Not Only but Also...The Video
results.creator_credit: John Street, Joe McGrath, James Gilbert, Dick Clement and BBC
results.brief_description: After 20 years apart, Peter Cook and Dudley Moore reunite and share their past memories of their comedy partnership together. We see many old comedy routines that they performed together.

results.title: The Best of zoom Martha
results.brief_description: Looks at the life of Martha Rudolph, a teenager suffering from epilepsy. Shows her positive outlook on life as well as her family’s reactions to her disability. Also mentions that there are degrees of epilepsy and provides a brief explanation of why epileptic fits occur.
results.description: Looks at the life of Martha Rudolph, a teenager suffering from epilepsy. Shows her positive outlook on life as well as her family’s reactions to her disability. Also mentions that there are degrees of epilepsy and provides a brief explanation of why epileptic fits occur.

results.title: The Best of The Two Ronnies
results.creator_credit: Peter Whitmore and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: This is classic British humor featuring a compilation of sketches, old and new, from the British television show “The Two Ronnies”. Ronnie Barker and Ronnie Corbett are two very clever, very funny comedians who compliment each other with perfect timing and an amazing use of, and play on, words. Their popular partnership has entertained audiences throughout the world and this video provides a sample of that wonderful unique sense of the ridiculous through the following sketches: Harry and Bert down the pub; Cinema commissionaire; Ice cream parlour sketch; Barber’s shop medley; Optician’s sketch; A life on the ocean waves medley and of course, The News. Written by: John Hyde, Spike Mullins, Gerald Wiley. Cast includes: Paul McDowell, Sam Kelly, Martin Duncan.

results.title: The Best of the original D Generation
results.brief_description: A selection of comedy sketches from the earliest years of one of Australia’s most original and inventive comedy teams - the D Generation. Originally discovered at a Melbourne comedy venue by an ABC producer, this young team of Melbourne University students went on to produce some of the most unique and memorable moments in Australian comedy, including The Late Show, Fast Forward and Frontline. Screened on the ABC over 10 years ago this compilation contains the sketches: the awesome scope of “The Making of Chisolm”, the baffling, enigmatic “Yellow thing with hinges”, gasp at the fashions in “Dag City” and reminisce with “Fart-Whistles”, “The Tense Family”, “Hijack Bloopers”, “The Discoverers”, the classic “Thunderbirds” and much more. Featuring Santo Cilauro, Marg Downey, John Harrison, Rob Sitch, Magda Szubanski and Michael Veitch.

results.title: The Best of the Big Gig (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Madness, mayhem and tons of laughs from the infamous Big Gig team, with all the best bits taken from their first series and cleverly put together on one video. Hosted by Wendy Harmer and including such favourites as Glynn Nicholas, Jean Kitson, The Empty Pockets, Anthony Ackroyd and the Doug Anthony Allstars.

results.title: The Best of the Addams Family. -Volume 5
results.brief_description: The creepy and kooky Addams family; Gomez, Morticia, Uncle Fester, Grandmama, Thing, Lurch, Pugsley and Wednesday are here for two episodes from the original television series. In “Green-eyed Gomez” Gomez suffers from a bout of jealousy when a former beau of Morticias, Lionel Barker (Del Moore), comes to stay. In an effort to keep his advances away from his wife Gomez hires a maid (Pattee Chapman) as a decoy but the jealousy is reversed when Morticia mistakes his actions for those of effection. To complicate matters Lionel proves to be a con-man. Directed by Jerry Hopper. In “Wednesday leaves home” Wednesday does a disappearing trick after being scolded for borrowing Uncle Fester’s TNT. A frantic Morticia and Gomez contact the Bureau of Missing Persons, only to discover that Wednesday was hiding in her room but the problems continue for Sergeant Haley (Jesse White) and Officer Thompson (Rex Kelloss) when they become involved with the Addams family. Directed by Sidney Lanfield. The series features John Astin, Carolyn Jones, Ted Cassidy, Jackie Coogan and Lisa Loring and based on characters created by Charles Addams.

results.title: The Best of the Addams Family. -Volume 4
results.brief_description: The creepy and kooky Addams family; Gomez, Morticia, Uncle Fester, Grandmama, Thing, Lurch, Pugsley and Wednesday are here for two episodes from the original television series. In “New neighbors meet the Addams family”, newlyweds Hubert and Amanda Peterson’s (Peter Brooks and Cynthia Pepper) honeymoon begins on a sour note when they move into the house next door to the Addams family. Alarmed by Fester tunneling into their house, Grandmama grinding the axe and Morticia and Gomez bathing the octopus, they must grin and bear it in an attempt to move out of the house. Directed by Jean Yarbrough. In “Morticia, the matchmaker”, Melancholia (Hazel Shermet), Morticia’s cousin, comes to visit after yet another future husband flees to join the Foreign Legion. After Gomez exhausts the list of eligible batchelors; a marriage broker, Lurch plus other business contacts, Melancholia sets her heart on a woman shy lawyer, Clarence P. Harvey (Lee Goodman) who has relutantly come to visit Gomez on business. Directed by Jerry Hopper. The series features
